review:
the name of the film should be
"guide to self destruction".üëàüëà

it is a tragic love story of an immoral (or unethical) man.

this is the best film ever made...which shows the consequences of not listening to the advise of elders üòÇ  ... and doing everything independently... according to your own immature mind.
...as if... nobody is superior to you... and you need not learn anything from anyone...!!!


the highlight of the film is -->

the film maker has done a very challenging job... of showing a morally incorrect man as a right & legitimate one...!!! ...thereby making him acceptable to the society (audience).

it is like.... serving the poison to the audience...by playing melodious background songs.
... and making sure... that the audience eating the poison...is feeling happy to eat it...!!!

believe it or not.... but it is the truth of the content of the film.

the hero's mentality in the film shows that there is no need of any rules [ do's & don'ts ] ... in the society.
....and anything can be done by anyone.
....and nobody should be answerable to anyone in the society.

just do whatever you like..!!

throughout the film, the hero never listens to anybody....
even his own family members and friends are worthless for him....till the end..!!

he is shown as always ready to fight with both  his enemy and even his own friends üëé  üëé  

the hero uses his family....  as a means of fulfilling his "drinking & smoking" needs.

and he uses his friends....  to show his power and influence in the locality.


whatever he believes and thinks...is the only thing that matters in the whole film.
the hero is cleverly portrayed by the film maker as -- "always right" in the movie.üëé  üëé  üëé  
....and his every non sense act and deed is glorified by melodious background tunes and songs.


the "hero" of the film shows that it is perfectly normal if you roam around all the day like a street-dog with your friends...without doing any work.
....and it is also ok if you feel no responsibility towards your parents, your work, even your own self...!!


this film shows that --
if you don't get the boy or girl of your choice,   then ---
you should either kill yourself (commit suicide).
as the heroine did in the film.

.....or you should consciously go to a mental asylum and spend there the rest of your life inspite of knowing that you are perfectly normal !!!
as the hero did in the film.


it is difficult to understand whether the lead actor is playing the role of a hero or a villian....!!!
because in the end....he ultimately does everything wrong with himself...!!


the film gives a very touching lesson that --->

when a person gets illusioned by the storm of uncontrolled desires arising in his mind... then the person ---
---forgets his/her own primary care
---loses emotional and mental balance
---throws away all the moral values into the dust-bin
---and starts doing the things which leads him/ her towards self destruction.

in other words, when self development 
leaves behind all the moral values....... and goes hand-in-hand with uncontrolled desires ....... then it leads to self destruction.

but the film justifies the hero's and heroine's every nonsense & irresponsible act ....by playing melodious background tunes and songs..... and showing that everything is fair in love
... (even self-destruction).üëé  üëé  

the main thing that makes this (morally rubbish)  film a 'hit'.... is that   the film maker has successfully been able to show & glorify... the hero's every " morally wrong act" .... as the "right & legitimate" one.

another thing making the film a "hit" is the songs.


we must remember that -->

1. self care is not selfish.
2. self destruction is not love.
3. self development is our foremost duty.
4. moral values is not something which is possessed by the fools.... but it is the jewel of the gentlemen.

this movie realeased in cinema hall when i was in 3rd standerd. my uncle bring pirated cd of this movie from market and it was the first chance to watch this movie though that time i didn't feel it but i liked the songs. after completing my degree, i again watched this movie and feel it first time. brilliant movie i have ever seen. every scene and dialogue are super. when you will see this movie first time, it will mark an impression on your mind at least one week, every time you will think about movie...ü§îü§îüòÅ

everything about the movie is great. be it acting, editing, direction. it's such a beautiful movie and is emotional as well. salman khan's acting is just great. it is one of the best bollywood movies made. it has lived up to the standards set by sethu- the original version. bhoomika chawla is just apt for the role. her innocent looks make her perfect for the role of nirjara. she is worth the award she won for her debut role. the music is just soothing. 
the movie is perfect

mr. yash yug. u told, u r the bigest fan of salman khan, i respect your choice. tere naam is a very good movie for me. salman khan did awesome job.  at first u should know, it was a remake of chiyan vikram's sethu. bt i think u didn't watch romantic/love story related films of other actors like irfaan khan, rajkumar rao, shahrukh khan, uttam kumar, chiyaan,  and u must watch their films. there r more better actors in india..........
